dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOLLY (18, hardcore, sleeps with a titanium biteguard) MEDITATES as she listens to a MOTIVATIONAL TAPE.

dialogues.speaker: MOTIVATIONAL VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Good morning, winner. Take a deep breath. (takes a deep breath) Good. You're ready to dominate this day. Her small bedroom is crammed with textbooks, notebooks, r books, academic awards. MOTIVATIONAL VOICE (0.S.) (CONT’D) You've worked harder than everyone, and that is why you’re a champion. Photos of women like Michelle Obama, RBG, Susan B. Anthon and Gloria Steinham line her bookshelves. MOTIVATIONAL VOICE (0.S.) (CONT’D) You understand that greatness takes sacrifice. Visualize what you still want to achieve. A “Valedictorian” ribbon lays across a graduation gown hanging on her mirror. MOTIVATIONAL VOICE (0.S.) (CONT’D) Stand upon the mountain of your success and look down at everyone who’s ever doubted you. (a beat) Fuck those losers. Fuck them in their stupid, fucking faces. Molly's eyes pop open. She removes her biteguard. INT. AMY'S CAR - DAY/EXT. MOLLY’S APARTMENT BUILDING - DA Amy (18, a big-hearted social justice warrior) pulls up t Molly's building, honking just as Molly comes outside-- t have this timed perfectly. Molly does a little dance for as she walks to the car.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh shit. Oooh, shit. Look at her go. Hold the phone. I’m coming... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Amy gets out of the car and starts DANCING WITH MOLLY on sidewalk. They dance for a long, long beat.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: I missed you.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I missed you. So much.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: It’s been one night. They just keep dancing.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Are we gonna go to school, or...

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: I don’t think we are.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Nope, we're just gonna stay right...here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy's rickety Volvo pulls up to their high school, alread buzzing with RAMBUNCTIOUS, GIDDY STUDENTS practically vibrating with last-day-energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The courtyard BUZZES with LOUD, Everybody's shrieking or laughing or crying with their friends. Molly and Amy walk through like salmon swimming upstream, dodging SKATEBOARD They pass an EMOTIONAL GIRL crying with her friends--

dialogues.speaker: EMOTIONAL GIRL
dialogues.text: I mean these were the best four years of our lives! Molly gives Amy a look.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Can you imagine a world in which these were actually the best four years of our lives? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Maybe if I immediately lost all my limbs, and my eyesight and hearing, and I was just like a human potato. I'd be like, “remember when I had my limbs and could see and hear? Those were the best four years.”

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Or if I was convicted of a crime I didn’t commit and spent the rest of my life in a Thai prison.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: If I spent the rest of my life reading in the backseat of a car.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: You do get so carsick. They walk INSIDE, where it’s even rowdier. Molly pushes h way through the chaos-- MOLLY (CONT’D) Where was this energy at my inauguration assembly, folks?! INT. PRINCIPAL BROWN’S OFFICE - DAY Molly and Amy stop outside PRINCIPAL BROWN’s office as he finishes the morning announcements on a PA SYSTEM.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BROWN
dialogues.text: ...and please do not attempt a senior prank. I have eyes and ears every where and you will not succeed. I don’t wanna have to suspend you right before graduation. I hope I never have to see any of you again. All right, signing off. Gooooo Crocketts! He turns off the PA system, putting it away, when--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Principal Brown.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BROWN
dialogues.text: ("kill me”) Molly. Amy. What’s shaking? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: I’m trying to make the transition to next year’s student government President as seamless as possible so when I’m up in New Haven--

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BROWN
dialogues.text: Yale. You can say just Yale.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Our class's official policy is to not discuss where people are attending next year. We don’t want anyone to feel insecure.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BROWN
dialogues.text: Very thoughtful.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Anyway, I need to go over the end- of-year budget numbers we have.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BROWN
dialogues.text: Really? Can’t you just do it with Nick? He’s your Vice President.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: We both know Nick only ran for VP because they plan the dances. That position is basically a popularity contest. He’s useless.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BROWN
dialogues.text: Ladies, it’s the last day. We did it! We got you through high school. and walks over to them. PRINCIPAL BROWN (CONT’D) Can’t we just graduate? Head off to college? Celebrate this wonderful achievement? He starts slowly closing the door. PRINCIPAL BROWN (CONT’D) Let’s just focus on getting through the rest of the day without anything horrible happening, okay?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, are you shutting the door on us? This isn’t subtle. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can’t just close the door. We will persist-- He shuts it in their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly and Amy walk back down the hallway. Amy watches as NICK holds court with his friends TANNER and THEO and a T OF GIRLS all trying to flirt with him. Nick RAMS his head into his locker, popping it open. Everyone laughs.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: It is kinda impressive. Nick’s like the great equalizer. Delegates from every group of girls are casting their ballots for his penis. A HOT GIRL, TRIPLE A, giggles at Nick, touching his chest

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: And Triple A takes the lead!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Don’t call her that.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Everyone calls her that. She gave “roadside assistance” to three senior guys last year.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: And do you hear them getting degrading nicknames?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: They call Sam Ross “Dick Splinter.”

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: That’s not derogatory. It’s a factual description. Sam Ross had an actual splinter in his penis. INT. MISS FINE’S CLASSROOM - DAY Molly and Amy walk up to MISS FINE (30, their teacher cru sitting at the teacher’s desk.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY /AMY
dialogues.text: Hi Miss Fine! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Fine holds up a completed NY TIMES CROSSWORD.

dialogues.speaker: MISS FINE
dialogues.text: Seven minutes twenty seconds. Molly and Amy groan and hold up the SAME CROSSWORD.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Nine forty-three.

dialogues.speaker: MISS FINE
dialogues.text: What am I gonna do without you two next year? Nobody else here even attempts the Thursday puzzle.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: We'll still send you our Sunday times. Amy and I are gonna Skype the crossword every weekend.

dialogues.speaker: MISS FINE
dialogues.text: You know what? I’m gonna give you guys my number. If you have any questions or need anything next year, text me. They try to play it cool, but this is the best moment of their lives. They each try to hand her their own phone, b Molly boxes Amy out and gets hers into Miss Fine’s hands. Triple A walks in and rolls her eyes--

dialogues.speaker: TRIPLE A
dialogues.text: I thought phones weren’t allowed in class, Miss Fine. Unless there’s an exception for ass kissers?

dialogues.speaker: MISS FINE
dialogues.text: You better put a dollar in the swear jar. (holding out her hand) The swear jar is my hand. Give me a dollar. Triple A shrugs innocently.

dialogues.speaker: TRIPLE A
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry, these shorts don’t have pockets. GEORGE and ALAN, two magnificently dramatic theater kids, push their way toward their seats-- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: EXCUSE ME
dialogues.text: (as he sits) There is no spacial awareness at this school... Molly and Amy squeal over Miss Fine’s number as they sett into their desks. HOPE (gorgeous, intimidating) watches.

dialogues.speaker: HOPE
dialogues.text: Hey, Amy. (Amy turns) Did you just score your teacher's phone number?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: HOPE
dialogues.text: (fatally sarcastically) Nice. Hope smirks at her and settles back into her seat. Amy frowns, stung. Theo and Tanner drop into their seats behind Molly and Am Theo calls up to Miss Fine--

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Miss Fine, you gonna come party with us tonight?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Did you just ask Miss Fine if she wants to party with you? You think she wants to watch you and your friends get drunk and break things?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Sorry, I was having a conversation with her, you were not a part of this--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Sit down, Theo. Theo glares but sits just as sweet, eager JARED (18) walk in. He’s decked out in the most expensive stuff possible, tries too hard to ever be truly cool. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: What up Miss Fine! Just wanted to drop off a last-day present for my favorite teach!

dialogues.speaker: MISS FINE
dialogues.text: Jared, you are not my student.

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: I've heard great things. (to the class) And everybody else got their graduation gifts, right? He shows off the shirt he’s wearing: a series of photos o his face inside his face inside his face. He steals

dialogues.speaker: JARED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pretty cool, right? Jare-bear coming at you from all angles.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Nobody asked for that.

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: (playing with the shirt) Big me, littler me, little baby Jare at the bottom. Baby Jare says “happy graduation, everybody!”

dialogues.speaker: HOPE
dialogues.text: Nobody’s gonna wear a shirt with your face on it, Jared. Not even ironically.

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: Well, agree to disagree, because they’re out in the cafeteria now--

dialogues.speaker: MISS FINE
dialogues.text: Jared! Go!

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: I’m gone. I’m out of here. (then, quickly) Bye Molly. one last look at Molly and hurries away as George and Alan jump on the makeshift STAGE at the front of the room. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: Fair townspeople. (no reaction) Fair townspeople!

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: Mark thy calendars and plan thy trip to the Drama Department’s summer program: Shakespeare in the Park-ing Lot.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: We'll be performing the Bard's comedies as modern tragedies outside Whole Foods across town! (very pleased with himself) It’s something we did last year in my program in Barthelona. When I lived in Barthelona. Molly closes her eyes, too annoyed to retort.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll be directing and Alan may be starring pending auditions.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: I do not audition, I am offer only. They hop off the stage and start handing out flyers.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: It sounds awesome, but I won’t be here.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Amy's spending the summer in Botswana helping women make their own tampons.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Gross.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Blood attracts lions. I’m saving lives. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: And I can’t either because I’m working all summer and also I don’t want to.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: You are a philistine.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Who would do theater when you could do debate?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Some of us know how to play well with others.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: And some of us know how to win.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Nobody's winning in that outfit. George glares at her as Miss Fine stands and CLAPS her ha

dialogues.speaker: MISS FINE
dialogues.text: Get in those seats. We still have one day of school left. Molly, why don’t you start us off. Molly stands as the rest of the class GROANS.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Thank you, Ms. Fine. If you guys recall how I ended yesterday... Amy sits back to watch, adoringly, as her best friend presents to the class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly walks her lunch past Nick as he’s trying to catch c Theo’s throwing in his mouth. She approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Nick--

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: One second.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Nick, we need to finalize the budget. Can you focus for 2 secon-- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He misses a chip, laughing. MOLLY (CONT’D) Nick I really need your--

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Sorry, we're playing a game where I’ve gotta catch it in my mouth, it’s complicated.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Yes, it looks super complicated. Molly gives up and walks over to Amy sitting at a table. MOLLY (CONT’D) I can’t believe I had to put up with Nick as my VP for a whole year. He’s allergic to work. He just goofs off and dicks around-- Molly realizes Amy isn’t listening-- she’s staring off at beautiful SKATER doing tricks with her friends. MOLLY (CONT’D) Just go talk to Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh, no. No thank you. I’m good.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Cool. Then I’ll go talk to Ryan. Molly moves like she’s going to dash over and Amy jumps t her feet. Molly gives her a look.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Fine! Fine. Amy takes a deep breath and psychs herself up as she walk over there. She’s so distracted by the psyching of hersel up that she doesn’t notice Ryan start to skate away and S right into her, knocking her off her board.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my god Ryan, I’m so sorry!

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (laughing) You’re got some sharp elbows. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Not as sharp as your...chin. (an awkward beat) Can you believe it’s the last day?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I know, it’s crazy. You don’t have to waste your free periods tutoring me French anymore.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (blushing) I didn’t mind. It was my job.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Hey, are you coming to Nick’s tonight? His aunt’s on a cruise ship that broke down and everyone got norovirus so he’s having a party at her house.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: That sounds so cool.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: No, it’s super bad. They’re all shitting in buckets and they’re stuck on a boat.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No I meant-- never mind. Ryan laughs. Amy laughs, too, not really sure why. Then a rides by between them and Amy panics and uses the distrac to hurry back to Molly.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Go back!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: It’s fine. Really. I don’t even know if she’s into girls.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: She wore a polo shirt to prom.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: That’s just her gender performance, not her sexual orientation.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, but I don’t get it. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Well gender is a construct of--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: That much I understand, thank you. It’s just a little bit shocking that you’re into Ryan. Your first crush was the little white cat from the Aristocats. You go from that to Avril Lavigne...it’s just not what I anticipated.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I just like that she’s always in a good mood. And her cute laugh. She seems like a fun person to have sleepovers and lie around with.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Excuse me? I’m a fun person to have sleepovers and lie around with. That’s literally all we do.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yeah but with her there’d be more...vagina involved. Amy watches longingly as Ryan laughs with some OTHER GIRL

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She said Nick’s having a party tonight.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Of course he would. He’s so stupid. Someone always gets arrested the night before graduation. Molly sees Amy watching and puts her arm around her. MOLLY (CONT’D) Amy do you know how many cute lesbians are going to be crawling up your vag at Columbia next year? Every time I come to visit you’re gonna be scissoring a different girl. You’re gonna be like Edward Scissor-Legs. Snipping left and right...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Dude, we’ve been over this. Scissoring is not a thing. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: How bout we don’t knock it til we try it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a CLASSIC 70's MUSCLE CAR screeches past them and into spot in the student lot. Amy shakes her head, annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Here comes the one percent. Jared's driving and GIGI (18, gorgeous, wild) leans out o the passenger seat, her hair in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That car should be in a museum. The Museum of Death. Because its smog is killing us all. Jared parks and Gigi turns, confused--

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Jared, I said door to door!

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: They spend every minute together. It’s so weird.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: We spend every minute together.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: But we’re equals. Gigi’s just keeping Jared around for when she needs a liver. They watch Gigi start crawling up Jared’s windshield.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You think it’s true his dad got him a sex worker for his 14th birthday?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: It’s too weird of a story to make up. And there were too many specifics. She had a hearing aid, he sprained his ankle... Jared notices them staring and waves-- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: WHAT UP CHICAS
dialogues.text: (then) You guys hungry? I brought back some soup dumps! They’re probably a little soggy now, but they’re great cold!

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Oh, God. I’m going to pee in your weirdass bathroom, watch my stuff.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (calling after her) Until all of us can pee without genitals, none of us can!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly is peeing in a stall when she notices graffiti on t wall: “your ugly.” She takes grammar as

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: These motherfuckers. Your ugly what? a pen from her pocket and corrects the graffiti’s THEO and TANNER enter the bathroom, mid- conversation. In her sta

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Okay, so, I'd marry the sex doll, fuck the soccer ball, and kill Molly.

dialogues.speaker: TANNER
dialogues.text: (laughing) Dude, no. 11, Molly FREEZES.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: There’s no other way. I can’t fuck her cause you know when I’m scared I can’t get hard. I can’t marry her cause I don’t believe in the institution. I have to kill Molly. And I know it’1l haunt me. I'ma peaceful person. Outside, another stall door opens and TRIPLE A emerges. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: TRIPLE A
dialogues.text: Are you talking about Molly Davidson? That girl is so weird. She always acts like she’s like, forty.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I wish she was forty, man. Women in their forties know themselves.

dialogues.speaker: TANNER
dialogues.text: She’s cute, but she’d probably make you quiz her on SAT analogies while you're fucking her.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Her vag is probably stuffed with diplomas, how you wanna bet? I bet it’s like a filing cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: TANNER
dialogues.text: I’ve got no problem with a filing cabinet. I would make passionate sex to Molly Davidson. (a beat) I'd just put a bag over her personality.

dialogues.speaker: TRIPLE A
dialogues.text: Molly's like a Butterface for personality. A Butterpersonality. They all laugh. In the stall, Molly’s trying not to cry. takes a deep breath -- and then she sets her jaw, stands walks out. Everyone stops, awkward.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Don’t stop on my account. Cause you know what? My vag is stuffed with diplomas, and soon it’s going to be stuffed with job offers, and glowing profiles, and commendations from my governor, because while you were studying for AP Hand Jobs I was kicking ass and busting curves. And that means I get to keep doing that at Yale next year. So, yeah, I like my choices. And wherever you are next year, I hope you do too. A beat. Molly's kind of impressed with herself. That spee was fucking awesome. Until-- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: TRIPLE A
dialogues.text: I’m going to Yale, too. Molly just stares at her for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TRIPLE A
dialogues.text: I'm incredible at hand jobs. But I also got a 1560 on the SATs.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: No you didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: TRIPLE A
dialogues.text: I got in early.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: To Yale?

dialogues.speaker: TRIPLE A
dialogues.text: (innocently) Tanner, where are you going to school?

dialogues.speaker: TANNER
dialogues.text: I’m playing soccer at Stanford.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Stanford University? What are you guys talking about?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I’m not going to college. (then) I got recruited to code for Google. It’s not Apple but the bennies are tight and it’s mid six-figures.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: You failed the seventh grade twice.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (shrugging) Rule of threes. Molly looks between them, realizing--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: You guys are being serious? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: TRIPLE A
dialogues.text: I may pretend I don’t know you next year. No offense.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: That’s not-- you’re not-- This isn’t possible. You guys don’t even care about school.

dialogues.speaker: TRIPLE A
dialogues.text: No, we just don’t only care about school. A kernel of panic starts growing in Molly’s stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly marches out of the bathroom. She runs into Amy, who notices Molly’s face--

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What’s wrong? Molly sees Nick running past them and grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Nick, where are you going next year?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: For college? I thought the whole thing was that we weren’t supp--

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Georgetown, jeez. Amy's surprised. Nick just takes off again. Molly sees Ho adjusting her makeup in the reflection of a trophy case--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Hope, where are y--

dialogues.speaker: HOPE
dialogues.text: I couldn’t be less interested in whatever's happening here. Molly just keeps marching down the hall toward Gigi. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Gigi! Quick question. Where are you going to school next year?

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Don’t judge me. It was my fifth choice. (then, disappointed) Harvard. That’s it. Molly’s head explodes, just as the BELL RINGS, people flood out of class, and Nick comes back around the corner, raising his arms--—

dialogues.speaker: SENIORS RULE
dialogues.text: He puts on a SNORKEL as he and his friends pull out_bucke of CONDOM WATER BALLOONS and start throwing them everywhe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly it’s total joyful chaos. Colorful splashes explo everywhere. Two SKATERS ride down the hallway spraying FI EXTINGUISHERS. Everybody’s shrieking and laughing and hav the time of their life -- except for Molly. In SLOW-MOTION a CONDOM WATER BALLOON flies through the a and EXPLODES on Molly’s face, and we CUT TO....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy drives a silent, soaking wet Molly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly leans against a well-worn PICNIC TABLE, in shock. A set out a CAKE and a MEMORY BOX and is playing an AUTO-HA making up a song to try to cheer Molly up.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: If you don’t say something in the next ten minutes / I’m gonna take you to the hospital / I don’t wanna say I’m getting concerned / But to be honest I’m getting concerned--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Triple A?! Fucking Triple A?! This is FUCKED. Amy slides away the auto-harp. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Ok, that’s obviously not helping...

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: We chose. We didn’t party because we wanted to focus on school and get into good colleges.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: And it worked.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: But the irresponsible people who partied also got into good colleges! They did both!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: So we messed up! We didn’t have to choose! They did both and we’re the only assholes who did one!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: We’re not assholes! Let’s just have some cake and celebrate the end--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: This is not a time to celebrate. (turning back to Amy) We have to go to a party tonight.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Let’s go to Nick’s party.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? No way.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: We only have one night left to have studied and partied in high school. Otherwise we’ll always be the girls who missed out. We never made out with strangers or snuck out and had to sneak home without waking up our parents or broke any rules!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: We broke rules! We have fake IDs. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Fake college IDs so we could get into their 24-hour library!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: That counts. Plus, what’s so great about breaking rules? Name one person whose life was better cause they broke rules.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Picasso.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: That’s not-- he broke art rules. Name someone who broke a real rule--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Rosa Parks.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (a beat) Name anoth--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Susan B. Anthony.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Goddamnit.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: I’m serious, Amy. Everyone thinks we're these robots. They think all we care about is taking a million APs and getting into Yale and editing Law Review at Georgetown and clerking for a Federal Judge between Junior and Senior Year before eventually being the youngest justice ever nominated to the Supreme Court of the United States! (then, awkwardly) In my case. You get my point. No one knows we can be fun too.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: We do. We know.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: (intense) They need to know. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Who's “they?”

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: We’re not one-dimensional. We're smart and fun. We have to do this.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: This is crazy. We graduate tomorrow. What if we get in trouble?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: You know we’re too smart for that. Plus Ryan wanted you to come. She’s gonna be there and you’re finally gonna make a move.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (flustered) What? That-- She-- no. Molly sits next to Amy.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: You've been out for two years and you've never kissed a girl. I want you to experience this. (intense) And what will I be doing during that time? I’m going to experience a seminal fun anecdote, and we're gonna change our stories. Forever. Amy's cracking.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: We were gonna watch that Ken Burns thing... Molly knows she’s got her. She jumps up, pumped--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: The Dust Bowl can wait, bitch! What took them four years, we’re gonna do in one night. She’s so pumped that she grabs the cake and TOSSES IT off hill. MUSIC’S UP as we CUT TO...  23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cozy flurry of protest signs, books, and photos of lady heroes like Gloria Steinem and Jane Goodall. Molly and Am burst inside and begin getting ready to go out: --Molly throws open a drawer labelled “MOLLY,” full of he clothes, looking for an outfit. --Molly and Amy admire each other’s OUTFITS:

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: No. Not acceptable.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Nope. This is not okay.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Who allowed you to be this beautiful?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Who allowed you to be this beautiful?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Who allowed you to take? My breath? Away?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Call the paramedics, all the police, because there has been an

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: You are STUNNING. I HAVE NO BREATH-- --Molly and Amy watch a YOUTUBE refresher on self-defense moves. They practice the GRIP ESCAPE MOVE. --Molly stuffs a copy of her passport and their fake UCLA in a HIDDEN MONEY BELT people use when traveling abroad. --Amy twists a MACE KEYCHAIN on her keys, demonstrating h it works to Molly:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Okay, this is important. Always make sure the safety is on-- SPPPP. It sprays mace. Molly screams. Amy screams-- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The safety’s not on! Don’t touch your eyes!
Amy puts some finishing touches on her outfit. She looks and sees Molly writing something at her desk.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What are y-- are you making a checklist for a night of partying?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Of course I am. (going over it) Killer outfits, safety tutorial, check check. Get address, secure safe transportation, you find Ryan, flirt for 15-20 minutes, bring her somewhere more quiet, ride her like a pony, I prove I’m fun, home by 1.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Are you gonna hook up with anybody? Molly scoffs very loudly.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: No. No way. High school boys are just horny, pimply distractions. Men don’t even come online til they’re 28 and then they don’t peak til they’re like 40. I’m holding out for an Econ TA next year.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: If Ryan wants to go further than making out, I have no idea what to do...down there.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Of course you do. You have the same parts she does, just take whatever you do to yourself and turn it upside down.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (reddening) I don’t really do anything... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Guys talk about this stuff all the time! It’s honestly offensive that we don’t. It’s misogynistic of us! A long pause.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What if I don’t use my hands?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: (impressed, whispered) You can make yourself come using only your mind? That’s like the one thing my mind can’t do!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No! I use...other stuff. Molly follows Amy’s eyes to her bookshelf.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: A book?! That's very Freudian. But I’d worry about paper cuts.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No! Like, something soft. Can we please stop talking about this? Molly eyes a couple of stuffed animals on Amy’s shelf.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: The alligator? Reveal a cute fuzzy ALLIGATOR with a long, phallic snout.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No. Can we just--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: The dog?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Stop. My grandma got me that right before she died.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Just tell me what--

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: The panda, okay? Whatever. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Molly eyes an innocent-looking panda bear on the shelf. I missing an eye.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: What happened to his eye?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (quickly) That fell off way before anything happened with us.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Does he talk dirty? Tell you how he’s endangered?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Stop!

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: You are such a sneaky bitch! I can’t believe I didn’t know you’ve been mounting that old fuzzy panda every night! (then) Honestly, it’s kinda exhilarating. I thought we knew everything about each other. It’s probably healthy for a relationship to have a secret, and now we have one. Amy nods a little too quickly, but Molly doesn’t notice. MOLLY (CONT’D) Do I have any? I once tried to masturbate with an electric toothbrush but I just got a terrible UTI.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I wish that had been a secret, but you’ve mentioned it many, many times. INT. LIVING ROOM - AMY’S HOUSE - DAY Amy and Molly sneak out of Amy’s room. Amy’s got an overn bag. They’re in puffy coats to hide their outfits.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I need you to do the talking. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They round 27.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Why don’t you just tell them we’re going to a party?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: They’1l ask too many questions and try to call Nick’s aunt. I’ve never lied to my parents before and you know when I lie I add too many details. Just make up a story. But don’t say we’re having a date night or anything.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Why? It’s funny that your parents think we’re secretly boning.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You’re not the one who has to deal with their creepy smiles when I tell them I’m meeting you at the library. When I am actually meeting you at the library.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: At least they support you. I wouldn't have expected that, given their whole...Jesus...thing. It’s nice! the corner to find Amy’s mom CHARMAINE (40s) and father DOUG (40s) preparing dinner in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: AMY MOLLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Heeeeeeeeey. Hil

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Charmaine, get to the safe room. We're being robbed by supermodels!

dialogues.speaker: CHARMAINE
dialogues.text: You girls look fabulous! And smart. And also brave.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: You guys cold? I'll start a fire, or I‘ll turn up the heat! Get those jackets off, dinner’s almost ready!

dialogues.speaker: CHARMAINE
dialogues.text: Try one of these. I’m calling them “diplo-meatballs.” They’re vegan. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Molly steps forward to take one but Amy holds her back.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (sotto to Molly) Nope. We can’t engage.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Char-char, Dougsicle...we were wondering...is it okay if Amy sleeps over at my house? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: CHARMAINE
dialogues.text: The night before graduation?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: My mom can take us to the ceremony. We just want more time together before she leaves for Africa.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: But we made mushroom-cap-and-gowns. There are special names for all of these things. (pointing to a dish) Chips and Sal-So Long, High School! (pointing to another dish) Cheese and Sala-me, being your dad, was the greatest honor of my life. (pointing to another dish) Melba Toast to your future-- Charmaine grabs his arm and gives him a meaningful look.

dialogues.speaker: CHARMAINE
dialogues.text: But you know what, we get it. We understand. We do. Because what you girls have is very special.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: It really is. They say you never forget your first...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Friend.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Special friend.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Normal friend. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: We're just so grateful we'll have the whole night. To really show each other just how much we care about each other.

dialogues.speaker: CHARMAINE
dialogues.text: That’s great.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Every inch of each other.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (quickly) We'll probably just do a Korean face mask.

dialogues.speaker: CHARMAINE
dialogues.text: I don’t need to know all the words. EXT. AMY’S HOUSE - NIGHT Molly and Amy run outside, zipping off their puffy coats. stuffs them in the overnight bag, tosses the overnight ba into the bushes, and they sprint down the street.

dialogues.speaker: MORE SOCIAL MEDIA VIDEOS AND PHOTOS
dialogues.text: QUICK CUTS of PARTY FOOTAGE -- People CHICKEN FIGHT in th pool...a DRUNK GUY bounces off a trampoline and lands in pool with a BELLY FLOP... Two GUYS wearing LAMPSHADES on their heads run and slam into each other like bulls. An audience watches Tanner eats a GHOST PEPPER, then FREAKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy's watching these on her cell as Molly makes phone cal

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh my God he ate a ghost pepper. He needs milk. Someone get him milk! (then, swiping through) Dude a lot of people are already there.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: (hangs up, frowns) Fuck, no one’s answering. (yelling at her phone) Somebody give us the ADDRESS! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: We've never hung out with any of these people outside of academic activities. They probably think we're calling about school stuff.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: You're right. Let’s just call a Lyft.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: We still don’t know where we’re going! We’d need a Lyft driver who knows where Nick’s aunt lives. Molly frowns, then gets an idea.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: We might have one of those. She dials a number.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Who are you calling?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about it...chica.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 70’s muscle car rolls up in front of them. The window r down...revealing JARED in the driver’s seat. He is THRILL

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: All aboard the SS Liiiit! (second-guessing himself) -..as Fuck! The SS Lit as Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: I am so glad you called! Sorry it took me so long, traffic was NERTS-- He scrambles out of the car as Amy glares at Molly. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: This car is like Guy Fieri’s wet dream.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: It’s a means to an end, Amy... Jared overly-suavely opens the door for Molly.

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: May I offer you the front, Mademoi-- Molly climbs in the back.

dialogues.speaker: JARED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Or the back, the back’s even better. Great air flow back there. INT. JARED’S CAR - NIGHT Jared gets in the driver’s seat and grins back at the gir

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: Time for some nights we’ll never remember with some friends we’1ll never forget!

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: You know where the party is, right?

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: Absolutely. We are headed to the biggest, coolest grad night party. It’s over on the west side. He turns on the car and the audiobook for “LEAN IN” by Sheryl Sandberg starts blasting. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: JARED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, this is embarrassing. You caught me. I have this thing where I like to hear the words of powerful women before I party to remind myself of the respect and awe you ladies deserve. Molly and Amy just stare at him. An awkward beat.

dialogues.speaker: JARED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s put something peppier on, get this party started! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He peels out, screeching his tires. INT. JARED’S CAR - A LITTLE LATER The muscle car flies down the highway, MUSIC BLASTING. Jared's phone RINGS -- “GIGI CALLING” -- and he hits igno

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: Sorry about that.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Just get it. Isn’t she your girlfriend or something?

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: What?! No! No way. No girlfriend for me. I can’t pick favorites. Too many ladies wanna lock this down. And they don’t have the code! 2831. That's my pin number, actually. So it is a code-- GIGI calls again, stopping the music and saving Jared fro himself.

dialogues.speaker: JARED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry, I'll just-- (answers it) What’s up, Gigi?

dialogues.speaker: GIGI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Jared, where the fuck did you go? I left my tin of special things in your car and I NEED IT.

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: Okay! We’re coming! Jeez. He hangs up and floors it. Molly reaches under the front and finds a MINTS TIN.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Do I want to know what a tin of “special things” is-- She opens it and it’s filled with WHITE POWDER. Molly SLA the tin closed again.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay this is drugs. This is a tin full of drugs. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: (jumps, startled) What?!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (laughing too loudly) Hey Jared! Jared! We’re actually just gonna hop out up here.

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: She's kidding.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No I’m not. Our friend just texted us that she...hit a possum with her car. But the possum didn’t die, its adrenaline and rage just made it stronger and it’s chasing her and she’s hiding and she needs help--

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: Oh my God. What kind of possum? Jared starts to merge right...

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Do not get off. Keep driving.

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: Is she gonna be okay? Do we wanna call her and make sure the possum--

dialogues.speaker: ENOUGH ABOUT THE POSSUM
dialogues.text: (a lightbulb) Jared, you took Spanish, right?

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: Si si, mi bonita mujer. Without missing a beat, Molly switches to FLUENT CHINESE.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: It’s gonna be fine. Trust me. Amy replies, also in FLUENT CHINESE. They’re so distracte that they don’t realize Jared’s pulling to a stop. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Don’t patronize me. What if Gigi takes it and dies and our prints are on the tin? Chain of custody! Criminally negligent homicide!

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: (opening the tin) Our prints aren’t on the powder. We could pour it out the window-- EXT. MARINA/INT. JARED’'S MUSCLE CAR - NIGHT Jared jerks the car to a full stop, jolting the girls and tin and sending the powder EVERYWHERE. They freeze, horrified, as the dust literally settles all over them.

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: And we are here! (seeing the mess) Oh, shit.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What do we do what do we do what--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Don’t move. Don’t inhale.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: We're going to jail. There are drugs in my ORIFICES--

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: What? No no no-- that’s not drugs. That's Gigi’s vitamins.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Her what?

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: You know, Vitamin D, B-12...Gigi crushes them up and snorts them. She says they work better that way. He starts to brush it off Molly--

dialogues.speaker: JARED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We'll get you cleaned up on board! Molly slaps his hand away, then realizes-- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: What do you mean “on board?”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly and Amy follow Jared to a dock leading to a PARTY YACHT. It looks like things are raging inside -- music PU and lights DANCE around the interior. A RED CARPET and ST AND-REPEAT leads up to a DOORMAN guarding the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: You said you wanted to go to the best party, so I brought you to the best party...which is my party! He points to a SIGN above the dock--

dialogues.speaker: JARED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Prepare to get BASHED (realizing) Not in like a violent way. Completely consensual bashing. “Prepare to Get Consensually Bashed.” I’1l have them change that. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Are you serious?! This is YOUR party?

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: You don’t know wanna go to Nick’s lame house party. A boat is international waters. We set our own rules. Just come check it out. It’s sick. The caterers said it’s the best party they’ve ever been to...and they worked Sasha Obama’s Sweet 16. Molly looks at Amy, who shrugs--

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: We still don’t know where the other party is. We might as well. I wanna meet someone who met Sasha. Molly sighs.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Fine. Respect for Sasha. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She turns back to Jared, throwing her arms up--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. Jared can’t believe it.

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: Yeah?! (trying not to freak out) Let’s GO! INT. JARED’S PARTY YACHT - NIGHT A giddy Jared leads Molly and Amy up the stairs to the bo

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: You ready? You getting excited? They reach the top and Jared dances his way into a comple empty boat, music echoing, tables of food left untouched.

dialogues.speaker: JARED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (still giddy) Welcome to the CLUB!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Ooh, no.

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: We’re on a boat right now! What’s up with that?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: There’s not a soul here, Amy. Molly passes a table of GIFT BAGS with Jared’s photo on t MOLLY (CONT’D) This is insane. He made gift bags? (almost concerned) There’s an iPad in here!

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: (appearing behind him) Pre-loaded with photos of our best high school memories! Class of 2019 SAY WHAT! Champagne? He takes them on a tour of the boat-- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JARED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There's also a masseuse in the back, male or female, and a photo booth, gambling over there... They hear a feral ROAR and suddenly GIGI is sprinting tow them, grabbing onto and squeezing Molly and Amy WAY TOO H

dialogues.speaker: I'M SO HAPPY YOU GUYS ARE HERE
dialogues.text: knew you guys partied. I told Jared, those guys seem quiet but they're probably spending every weekend at like, a sex dungeon. She jokingly bites Amy’s arm. Amy laughs a little, terrif Then Gigi GASPS--

dialogues.speaker: GIGI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oooh try one of these STRAWBERRIES! She grabs a plate of strawberries and shoves it at them s forcefully they just take it and eat it.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: This is pretty good--

dialogues.speaker: WAIT.
dialogues.text: She grabs Amy’s hair and starts sniffing it, then SUCKING

dialogues.speaker: GIGI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You taste like my vitamins! I love you. You’re coming with me. DANCE

dialogues.speaker: PARTY UPSTAIRS
dialogues.text: Gigi grabs Amy’s hand and drags her away. Amy shoots Moll “help me” look as Jared tries to get back to the tour--

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: Wanna put our names on the list for the masseuse? Or a VR experience? Look what I found! He puts a customized “Molly” hat on her head.

dialogues.speaker: JARED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You look amazing. A WAITER walks up, desperate to give somebody food-- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: APPETIZERS WAITER
dialogues.text: Buffalo chicken spring roll?

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: (takes one, then) This is like the pre-game. VIPs only. But people will come. I got all this food, I have free alcohol, drugs... I don’t even do drugs, but other people will.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND APPETIZER WAITER
dialogues.text: Portabella slider? Jared takes two. Molly gestures around the room--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Dude, this doesn’t work. You can’t...buy people’s affection.

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: I'm pretty sure you can. I’ve seen it a lot. My parents did. Their parents did.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Just-- stop trying so hard. It’s embarrassing. People can sense it, and it turns them off.

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: But you try hard. You try hard at everything. That’s what I like about you. Molly’s startled. And suddenly self-conscious. And awkwar JARED (CONT’D) MOLLY I just meant-- I’m gonna-- go-- this way. She turns to go, running right into a THIRD WAITER-- She takes

dialogues.speaker: THIRD APPETIZER WAITER
dialogues.text: Lamb meatb--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Oh my God you guys are EVERYWHERE. a meatball and hurries away.  39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy stands to the side as Gigi dances under the twinkling lights like Penny Lane in Almost Famous, a joint hanging of her mouth. Gigi offers it to Amy--

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: You want?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No thank you. Not a drug person.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Not even pot? I feel like it’1l help you relax.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: It doesn’t work for me. I ate a legal pot brownie when Model UN went to Amsterdam but as soon as I got high I just cried about the fact that one day my mom will die.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: That’s crazy! I have the exact same thing!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Yes! I lost my virginity in what I thought was a park, but it turned out to be a graveyard and now the ghost spirits live inside my eggs, waiting to be reborn.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: That’s...not at all the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: I always felt like we were similar. I’m really gonna miss you. A WAITER climbs up to the deck and sees Amy and Gigi--

dialogues.speaker: YACHT WAITER
dialogues.text: Hey, you guys can’t smoke up here. Gigi turns to the Waitress, suddenly intense. And Mama-Be defensive of Amy. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: What’d you just say to her?

dialogues.speaker: YACHT WAITER
dialogues.text: I said it to you. You can’t smoke.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Don’t speak to her that way.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Is the “her” me? Cause I’m fine--

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: (pointing to Amy) This is my best friend in the fucking world--

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Whoa, that’s not-- she’s not--

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: And we'll fucking fight you to the DEATH. Gigi grabs her Vodka bottle and SHATTERS IT against the s fo the boat! Amy jumps--

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh my GOD!

dialogues.speaker: YACHT WAITER
dialogues.text: Okay. I’m calling security. Molly climbs up to the upper deck--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Amy, we need to get the fuck out of here-- Gigi grabs Amy and Molly’s hands as FIREWORKS start explo over the boat.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: There’s only one thing we can do now. Jump.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY AMY
dialogues.text: No, no thank you. What?! They try to get away but Gigi has a killer grip on their wrists and drags them to the side. Molly and Amy look at other, concerned. Jared climbs up to the deck and sees th (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: What are you guys doing?

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: A swan dive into the future! Molly and Amy frantically try to wiggle out of her grip--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Seriously, Gigi, I’m not jumping--

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: One--

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (freaking out) Molly?

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Two--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: (remembering) The grip-escape move! In one swift motion Molly and Amy use the self-defense GR ESCAPE MOVE to whip their arms free just as Gigi dives of the side. Molly and Amy tumble to the ground as they hear Gigi’s SPLASH! Jared races to the side of the boat--

dialogues.speaker: JARED
dialogues.text: Gigi! Are you okay?!

dialogues.speaker: GIGI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I changed my mind! I wanna be back on the boat!

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: She’s okay! BAIL! BAIL!! Molly and Amy scramble up and race the hell out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly and Amy sprint down the dock and across the street the parking lot, giddy with adrenaline. When they finally stop, out of breath, they burst out laughing. Adrenaline- fueled, guttural, best-friend laughter.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: She’s NUTS! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I think she would have killed for us. Like I say I’d kill someone for you but she really would kill someone for you.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Oh, my God, I’m so sweaty. We have to change or wash off or something before we get to Nick’s.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (surprised) You still want to go to Nick’s?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: You don’t?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: We went to a party! We did it. Let’s go home.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: (voice dropping) Amy.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Don’t do your lecture voice--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: (definite lecture voice) That was not a party.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: It was a party.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: That was a detour. It was Jared’s lame attempt to buy friends. We’re A+ people. We need to go to an At party. Like this... Molly opens her phone and pulls up more IPHONE PARTY FOOT --The party’s bigger and rowdier...someone SLIP-N-SLIDES the pool.. -a group cooks MAC-N-CHEESE in the kitchen...a PASSED-OUT-GUY lays in a pile of BEER CANS like an ANGEL. The video’s interrupted when a TEXT from ALAN pops up: “YASSSS! Address is 3831 Westchester Place.” A PIN pops u (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my God Alan responded. We have the address! I’m calling a Lyft. (checking her phone) Honestly, you should call it, because my score is...very low. I’m too abrasive with the drivers...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Molly, I’m gonna go home. But if you wanna to go to Nick’s, go, just come over after--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Malala. Amy stops. That’s a big deal.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Whoa. Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: I’m calling Malala.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You're sure? You only get one Malala a year.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: I’m calling it. I need your full support, no questions asked. You are coming with me. Amy takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Okay. (holding her hands up) Malala.
Molly and Amy climb into the back of a a PARTY LYFT. The whole backseat is decorated with CHRISTMAS LIGHTS.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Jordan?

dialogues.speaker: LYFT DRIVER
dialogues.text: Yep, are you Am-- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He turns around -- the driver is Principal Brown.

dialogues.speaker: LYFT DRIVER/PRINCIPAL BROWN
dialogues.text: --y-motherfuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly and Amy sit in the back, awkward, as Principal Brow drives, even more awkward. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BROWN
dialogues.text: You know, this is a great way to supplement the old income. Teacher’s salaries and all...

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY AMY
dialogues.text: It’s so terrible. They’re a disgrace.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BROWN
dialogues.text: And I'm working on a book and I can think about it while I’m driving so it’s like getting paid to write-- HONNNNNK. Principal Brown lays on the horn-- PRINCIPAL BROWN (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: A LANE
dialogues.text: Molly and Amy grip hands, stunned, as Principal Brown sna back to total pleasantness-- PRINCIPAL BROWN (CONT’D) Sorry about that. That guy was nuts. This town, man. Lotta angry people in this town. He smiles and drives for a very awkward beat, until-- PRINCIPAL BROWN (CONT’D) You guys want some music?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY AMY
dialogues.text: Yes! Genius. Please! Please. He puts on the radio VERY LOUDLY. Amy and Molly slide dow into their seats for a little privacy. Amy checks her wat

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're gonna get to Nick’s so late. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Everyone shows up to parties late. It’s cooler to be late. We’ll get there right at the crest and before you know it you’ll be neck-deep in Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Neck-deep in what direction?!

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: You tell me.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I don’t know! I don’t know anything. This is like your nightmare about having to land that commercial airliner but much, much worse.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Is it worse? Because I had the lives of a hundred people in my hands. My crew was counting on me. I was their Sully.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I’m very stressed about this!

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Okay! I know you are. (then) If only there was, like, a video of people hooking up and having sex we could watch...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, are you talking about porn?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: All I’m saying--

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: It’s not like anyone would know if you watched one porn one time. Think of it as a documentary. It’s just a sexy documentary. It’s a hot doc. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Every woman in it is like a European trafficking victim!

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Are you judging other people’s sexual preferences? Because you fuck a panda every night...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (angry whisper) Fuck a panda! You’re soooo funny--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: You're gonna sit here and judge me for dabbling in pornography. I thought you were a sex positive feminist! Molly takes out her phone.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Are you insane? Principal Brown is four feet away from us.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: I have headphones! She puts an earbud in Amy’s ear. Amy sighs--

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Fine. But once we get a sense of the mechanics I’m shutting it off.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Of course. This is for educational purposes. She hits play. They're both immediately very drawn to whatever’s happeni on screen. They stare, mesmerized. A long moment. Amy pok Molly without tearing her eyes away--

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Plug in, your phone’s gonna die. Molly clears her throat.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Um, Principal Brown? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BROWN
dialogues.text: Principal Brown was my dad! Call me Jordan!

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: No thank you. Principal Brown, do you have a phone charger?

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BROWN
dialogues.text: No, I don’t. (then) I’ve got like thirteen! He tosses her the largest dongle she’s ever seen. She fin her cord and plugs it in. Amy hasn’t torn her eyes away--

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I didn’t know you could do that from that angle.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: What did I miss?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Scrub back. This is important. Principal Brown notices them watching something.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BROWN
dialogues.text: Oh, you wanna listen to your music? I can just plug it in up here... Molly and Amy realize too late what button he’s reaching

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: The most intense porn sounds blast over his speakers. Wet slaps and moans and squeaks-— Molly and Amy SCREAM, HORRIFIED. Principal Brown SCREAMS, terrified. Molly drops the phone and she and Amy scramble find it and unplug it-- They finally unplug it and the noises stop. They all sit there, frozen. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BROWN
dialogues.text: Was that Cardi B?  48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly and Amy hurry out of the car. They hold on to each other but can’t make eye contact as they scramble away--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY AMY
dialogues.text: I cannot. Believe. That Oh my God. Oh my god. Oh my happened. I’m gonna die. I God. I can’t believe you made might die. me do that. You’re the devil. Then they take in the house: it’s enormous. Most of the lights are off and it’s quiet. Amy looks around--

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're sure this is the address?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Maybe the pool’s in the back?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: It doesn’t sound like a party. What if this is a trap? What if a predator stole Alan’s phone and sent that text to all the girls in his contacts hoping someone would just show up? Suddenly a STUDENT dressed as a BUTLER opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus-—

dialogues.speaker: BUTLER
dialogues.text: Come in. Molly and Amy share a look, but go inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk inside the main foyer. At the top of the stairc two FRESHMAN STAGEHANDS hold giant feather fans. They pul them back to reveal Alan perched in a silk pink CLAMSHELL made by the theater department. He’s in FULL DRAG. Alan h a hand to his face and lets out a WAIL.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: What the fuck...

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: He’s dead! He’s DEAD! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Who's dead?!

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: My husband's been killed! Alan tries to descend the stairs but one of the Stagehand standing on his train. George storms in.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Alan, you don’t have to do your entrance every time someone arrives! (then, seeing the girls) What are you guys doing here?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: It’s a murder mystery party. I’ve been prepping for months. Molly looks around, realizing--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Wait, this is your house? (then) Alan! I was VERY clear in my text! We're looking for Nick’s party--

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: There’s been a Killing in Times Square! Robert was an esteemed Broadway director and the love of my life and he’s been killed like a dog in the street!

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: That sounds very tragic, but there’s been a mistake. We’re trying to get to Nick’s party. We can’t find the address. Do you know where it is?

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: I don’t know a Nick! I only know sorrow and GRIEF.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: You're at a ten and I need you at a two! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Alan glares at him, then floats off.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: I have a wake to plan! George turns to Molly and Amy. (then, to Molly and Amy) If you're here you may as well take some of the extra characters. He pulls them over to a TABLE where an ASSISTANT hands hi two CHARACTER PACKETS and NAME TAGS.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: No, we don’t need characters, we’re not staying-- He hands one to Amy--

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: “Adorable farmer new to the city.”

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (pinning one on Molly) And “hideous, barren orthodontist.”

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: What?! Why am I barren?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Am I here to farm? Or have I given up that life?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: (reading the packet) This just says orthodontist.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Your backstories are in those packets.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Seriously, we have to go. We’re trying to find Nick’s party.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Is that the party where someone ate a ghost pepper? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Somebody here came from that party I think. Maybe the Mayor? (shooing them) Go. Immerse yourselves. Review your histories in the parlor. Molly grabs Amy and drags her into the parlor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOZEN DRAMA KIDS in varying levels of costume speak theatrically with each other. Molly scans the room as Amy opens her envelope to read her backstory--

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh my God. I came to the city to hide my pregnancy from my very religious parents! (scrutinizing the room) I wonder who the father is. They see a theater kid sprawled on the floor, “dead,” as GIRL genuinely WEEPS over him, moaning. Amy’s impressed--

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She’s really good. The weeping girl looks up-- it’s Gigi. Gigi immediately s crying and brightens--

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Oh my god you guys are here! Molly and Amy SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: AMY MOLLY
dialogues.text: What the fuck?! What-- how did you get here?

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: How did you get here?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: And how are you dry?

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: How are you dry? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (walking by, to the BODY) Aaron, I can see you breathing. (to Gigi, “directing” ) Gigi, mmm...dig deeper. Gigi goes back to SOBBING over the body. Molly and Amy ke walking, so confused. They push open a door revealing-- GEORGE'S MOM, DAD and 10 YEAR-OLD SISTER doing a PUZZLE i the kitchen. George’s Mom looks up. GEORGE’S MOM Oh, is it over?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (walking by) Mom DO NOT TALK TO THE ACTORS! The house is mine until llpm!! His sister gives him a look--

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I swear to fucking God Cindy... Molly and Amy hurry out of the kitchen, running directly Gigi, waiting for them with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY AMY
dialogues.text: Oh my GOD. Jesus CHRIST, Gigi!

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Guys, the re-election’s coming up and I need to know if I have to buy your votes.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Re-election--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Wait, you’re the mayor? You know where Nick’s party is?

dialogues.text: Of course I do. I know where all the parties are.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Where is it?!

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Come to my office. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: GIGI, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: We won't.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Not even each other.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: ...Okay.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Nick’s party is... (a dramatic pause) At his aunt’s house.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: WE KNOW IT’S AT HIS-- Oh my god. Amy, we have to go.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: By the way, I’m very impressed at how well you’re holding it together.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: I thought the strawberries would've hit by now.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Why would strawberries hit us?

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Because they were dipped in such an unbelievably potent drug. It’s like Ayahuasca, but Asian. Asiahuasca. (then) I told you guys that, right? Molly turns back to Amy -- but Amy’s eyes are wide as saucers, brimming with tears.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: My mom’s already 52.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: No. 53. She pulls them to a nook BEHIND A CURTAIN and lights hers with a FLASHLIGHT. She lowers her voice. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: She’s closer to being 100 than she is to being born.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: No no no no. Molly grabs Amy and pulls her UP THE STAIRS and into Geor SISTER’S BEDROOM. INT. GEORGE'S SISTER’S BEDROOM - NIGHT It’s a classic GIRL’S ROOM -- everything is COMPLETELY PI DOLLS and TOYS and PINK BOOKS line the shelves.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: My mom has a scarf that color.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Once I threw up and my mom caught it in her hands cause she loves me.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: We’re gonna be fine. We are healthy, nubile young women and we just need to stay calm and we're gonna be fiiiiiiiii-- They both PASS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Downstairs, George is settling everyone in to dinner when they hear the THUMP from upstairs. Annoyed, he rings his DINNER BELL for a very passive-aggressively amount of tim INT. GEORGE'S SISTER’S ROOM - NIGHT MOLLY'S POV: she’s flat on the floor. Everything looks hu She sits up and sees her PLASTIC HAND--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: What? What the fuck? What the fuck? What is happening... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She turns and sees that Amy’s become a BLONDE “SEXY FARME DOLL. Molly SCREAMS. Then Amy screams when she sees that Molly's become a BRUNETTE “SEXY NURSE” DOLL.

dialogues.text: Why do you look like that?!

dialogues.speaker: DOLL AMY
dialogues.text: Molly, you’re a fucking DOLL.

dialogues.speaker: DOLL MOLLY
dialogues.text: No, you're a fucking doll! Doll Amy notices a CORN COB attached to her hand.

dialogues.speaker: DOLL AMY
dialogues.text: What? What is this?! She pulls it off with a painful THWOP--

dialogues.speaker: DOLL AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: OWWW! FUCK that hurt! Doll Amy tries to stand but she falls over.

dialogues.speaker: DOLL AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can’t hold my top up! My boobs are too heavy! I have no core! Doll Molly tries to stand but she falls over, too--

dialogues.speaker: DOLL MOLLY
dialogues.text: Our legs don’t bend! They're twice as long as our torsos! These proportions are insane! Where’s my chub?! She notices a VANITY with a set of drawers and a big MIRR on top and awkwardly protractor-walks toward it--

dialogues.speaker: DOLL AMY
dialogues.text: Wait where are you going?!

dialogues.speaker: DOLL MOLLY
dialogues.text: I have to see for myself! Doll Amy follows, waddling awkwardly behind her--

dialogues.speaker: DOLL AMY
dialogues.text: Wait for me! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Doll Molly starts climbing the drawers by inch-worming he legs -- spreading them in a split and then squeezing them back together to propel up. Doll Amy copies her. Doll Molly grunts and pulls herself to the top--

dialogues.speaker: DOLL MOLLY
dialogues.text: Okay well I’ve never done splits in my life! Legs aren’t supposed to bend like this! Doll Amy gets to the highest drawer-- then SLIPS and fall

dialogues.text: Doll Molly races to the edge and sees that Doll Amy’s hol on to the edge of the highest drawer!

dialogues.text: Help! Help Molly!

dialogues.speaker: DOLL MOLLY
dialogues.text: Don’t look down Amy! No! Doll Molly tries to reach her hand down to Doll Amy--

dialogues.text: I can’t reach! Doll Molly drops her way-too-long leg down to Doll Amy-- sees the HOLE in Amy’s hand (from the corn cob)--

dialogues.text: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And SHOVES her hand hole onto the heel of the stiletto wi another painful THWOP! She YELPS in pain as Doll Molly sw her leg around, dropping Doll Amy to safety. They climb t their feet and finally see themselves in the mirror--

dialogues.speaker: DOLL AMY
dialogues.text: Oh my GOD.

dialogues.speaker: DOLL MOLLY
dialogues.text: What the fuck am I wearing?! They rips off their CLOTHES, looking down--

dialogues.speaker: DOLL MOLLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: WHERE’S MY VAG?

dialogues.text: Molly I have no genitals.

dialogues.text: Amy, no. Don’t get sucked in. This is our nightmare--

dialogues.speaker: DOLL AMY
dialogues.text: (admiring herself) I know this is unrealistic and bad for women but...is it bad? Because I feel pretty good. Amy turns to admire her ass-- DOLL AMY (CONT’D) I mean this ass won't quit.

dialogues.text: I don’t need to use my brain. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.text: Doll Amy slowly raises her leg parallel to her body, feel her crotch--

dialogues.speaker: DOLL AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just need to be smooth and flexible. She pops up and starts to cat-walk-- DOLL AMY (CONT’D) Look at you, you bad bitch. My my my. Mmmmm.

dialogues.speaker: DOLL MOLLY
dialogues.text: NO! I won’t let you do this. We have to get the drug out of our systems-— Doll Molly tries to get her hand into Doll Amy’s mouth, b Doll Amy slaps her hands away.

dialogues.text: Stop it! They start slapping at each other as Doll Molly keeps tri to shove her hand in Doll Amy’s mouth--
