dialogues.text: (fighting her off) Let! Me! Have! This! Body! They get into a full-on slap fight and don’t notice how c they are to the edge of the dresser and as they keep figh they SLIP AND FALL OFF!  59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan and the rest of the Murder Mystery participants are sitting around a grand DINING ROOM TABLE for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Now that our amuse bouche of bacon- wrapped dates is over, why don’t we play a rousing round of “J’ACUSSE!” Suddenly they hear a CRASH-- and then see a still super-h Molly and Amy walk past, not bending their arms or legs, dolls. It’s like they’re in stiff slow motion. The group watches, bewildered, as Molly and Amy doll-walk outside. Molly stops at the door and turns to the table:

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Fuck you George. They doll-walk outside.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: Who is she supposed to be?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: The orthodontist. EXT. GEORGE’S HOUSE - A LITTLE LATER Molly and Amy lay on the lawn, finally coming down. Amy p one hand under her bra and another down her pants.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: We're okay. We’re okay! And we did it. We went to two parties, we accidentally did drugs-- we can say we went out. Let’s go home. Molly sits up.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: What? No. We have to stick to the plan. The plan is to go to Nick’s.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Dude, nothing has gone according to plan tonight.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Which is why we have to STICK to the plan. We’ll call another Lyft-- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Why are you being so pushy?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Honestly, pushy is a compliment. You know who else is pushy? Diane Sawyer. My girl Joan of Arc. Queen Noor of Jordan--

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (defensive) I know where Queen Noor is from!

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Once we get to Nick’s, all of this will be worth it--

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Forget about Nick’s! No one will even tell us where it is. Why are you so obsessed with his party?

dialogues.speaker: GIGI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Because she loves him. Molly and Amy JUMP-- Gigi’s standing out on the SECOND FL BALCONY, looking over them.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Oh my God, Gigi, STOP DOING THAT.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Molly loves Nick. Molly scoffs but her face goes BRIGHT red as she stammers

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Can you please stop repeating that sentence? Because it’s not true.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Molly hates Nick.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: She projects disgust to cover up a deep desire. How many times a day does she bring him up? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: She brings him up to complain--

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: That’s still talking about him. Look, the auras are very clear. I don't write them. I just read them.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: No. No. Nope. You just drugged us and tried to throw us off a boat, so nothing you say is of any value to us. Gigi flips Molly off. MOLLY (CONT’D) Okay, you can stop flipping me off, because YOU should flip off. So...shut the fuck up. Alan bursts outside the front door, looking for Gigi--

dialogues.speaker: ALAN
dialogues.text: Madame Mayor! What are you doing out here? (sotto) George locked himself in the closet. He spins on his toes and floats back inside with Gigi as turns to Molly, who’s very flustered. Amy realizes--

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Dude.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Dude...? Molly finally turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: No! I don’t like him. Yes, maybe he’s classically, traditionally handsome, and weirdly charming, so maybe my innate biology registers him as an ideal mate. And yes, maybe I occasionally fantasize about him sweeping me off my feet. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And some weaker people might call that a tiny crush but I can fight against it, I can ignore it because we all have weird interests and all that matters is that we shove them down and never think of them again. Amy just looks at her friend. She gives her a

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You don’t have to shut anything down.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Yes I do. Because I can’t like him. Maybe my body likes him but my mind knows that’s stupid, because he’s a jock who only cares about being cool and having fun and he doesn’t even look at girls unless they look like Triple A and he doesn’t even want people like me at his parties because I’m a butterpersonality. Amy slaps Molly across the face.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: How dare you say that about my best friend.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: WHAT the FUCK--

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: If you ever say anything like that about yourself again I will fucking lay you out. You are the smartest, strongest, coolest, most stunningly gorgeous creature this high school and this earth has ever seen and Nick would be lucky to be a footnote in your story. And we are going to his party. Molly's amazed--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I’m dead serious. If Nick’s what you want, that’s what you deserve. 62. small smile. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She stands.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: How? How are we gonna find out where the party is?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: By doing what we do best. (dramatically) Motherfucking homework. A kickass HIP HOP SONG starts as we CUT TO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly and Amy stride into the UCLA library like they fuck own the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Molly and Amy slam their bags down at their usual table stretching their knuckles like they’re about to play Moza --Molly runs her fingers along a list of REAL ESTATE PURCHASES by people with the last name “Howland.” -- Amy makes notations on a huge MAP. --Molly reads a book of CITY RECORDS as a COLLEGE COUPLE loud, gross sex behind her. -- They watch a new SOCIAL MEDIA VIDEO: Theo’s preparing KARATE CHOP a stack of 15 PIZZA BOXES.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Wait, look. She zooms in on the STACK of pizza boxes.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s at least 15 pizza boxes. How many orders that big could Lido’s have filled tonight?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: (realizing) Genius...  64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAT, the LIDO’S DELIVERY GUY, gets in the front seat hold two PIES. He’s grumbling to himself--

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Two half-cheese, half-sausage pizzas are just one cheese and one sausage pizza you fucking morons-- Amy and Molly rise from the backseat like it’s a carjacki They’ve tied their hair into ponytails in front of their faces, like a makeshift mask.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYBODY STAY CALM
dialogues.text: Pat SCREAMS BLOODY MURDER.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: WHAT THE FUCK?! What the fuck?! What the fuck is this?!

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Oh my God oh my God is this some kind of Manson family bullshit?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No! No! Everything is gonna be just fine, you’re just gonna give us the address where you delivered pizza earlier tonight! A beat.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, are you guys out of your fucking minds? How old are you?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: (lowest possible voice) Does not matter!

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Okay, that did not make you sound older. So you’re basically children and you willingly got into a strange man’s car. Do you even have a weapon? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Molly and Amy exchange a glance.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (whispered) If we claim to have a weapon this might be a felony.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: So you're wearing your hair as a mask and you tried to rob someone without a weapon? He pulls a GUN from the glove compartment.

dialogues.speaker: PAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Because I do have a weapon! The girls SCREAM and duck--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Why do you have a gun?!

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: To protect myself from bad people! Something you should be thinking about! Did sexual assault play into your planning at all?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: (admitting) Not really.

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: I could've just locked the doors and driven off! I could’ve made you my play things! Amy holds up her phone, frozen on the PARTY FOOTAGE:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Just please give us the address where you delivered this huge order earlier tonight. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Fine. But only because I’m afraid if I don’t some dog walker will find your bodies tomorrow morning. He finds the address on his phone and holds it up so Moll can type the address into hers. As she opens her phone--

dialogues.speaker: PAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t let me see your passcode. Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Thank you. (then) Since we're already in the car, could you maybe...drive us there?

dialogues.speaker: PAT
dialogues.text: Sure, buckle up. The girls start to buckle their seatbelts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lido’s car zooms away as Molly and Amy celebrate--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: You were incredible! So scary!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: If you wanted to be a criminal you would be the best fucking criminal in Los Angeles. Now let’s call a chariot to... Her face falls. She feels her pockets.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: FUCK. I left my phone in his car! Why did I have to use a visual aid! (calling after the car)

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: We'll get it tomorrow. I can call-- (then, realizing) (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Oh my God I’m at 2%. How is my battery so low?!

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: But then if my phone dies and the driver can’t find us we’re fucked! Suddenly she gets a lightbulb and frantically dials a num

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What? Who are you calling?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Pick up pick up pick up-- (rapid fast) Hi it’s Molly and Amy we need help we're stranded on Ventura and Lemon can you pick us up please we need-- (a beat, then) It died. Cross your fingers.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly and Amy sit on the curb, waiting, nervous.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: We could hitchhike.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Are you aching to be murdered?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I’m just throwing out suggestions. The Subaru squeals up to the girls. The DRIVER gets out b the headlights are too bright to see who it is. She walks around the car, finally revealing... Miss Fine. She smiles and waves.

dialogues.speaker: MISS FINE
dialogues.text: You girls need a ride? The girls SQUEAL and sprint to her car.  68. INT. MISS FINE’S CAR - NIGHT Molly and Amy ride in the back as Miss Fine drives. They' completely giddy.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Thank you so much, Miss Fine. You totally saved us.

dialogues.speaker: MISS FINE
dialogues.text: Please, you two saved me from re- watching Gilmore Girls. I've seen it like fifty times. (then) Now what is this address I’m taking you?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Nick’s aunt’s house. It’s a...party, technically.

dialogues.speaker: MISS FINE
dialogues.text: Wait. You want me to drive you to an unsupervised house party? Molly and Amy freeze.

dialogues.speaker: MISS FINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good! I’m glad you guys are having a little fun before graduation.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: MISS FINE
dialogues.text: Yes! I don’t want you guys to make the same mistakes I did.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: MISS FINE
dialogues.text: I spent the majority of my 20's overcompensating for the fact that I never had fun in high school. And then the pendulum swung way too far in the other direction. I went crazy. I had some really dark moments there in my twenties. Some really dark moments. (remembering) Like, it was bad. Did you know I’m banned from Jamba Juice? (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MISS FINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not a single Jamba Juice. Every Jamba Juice. That came down from corporate. Do you know how many Jamba Juices there are in this country? Like a bajillion. It’s a national chain. It’s a sensation. (then) I don’t want that for you. You still have a chance. I want you two to go to this party and I want you to have fun. Because tonight is your NIGHT!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: MISS FINE
dialogues.text: Now what are you wearing?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: This. This look.

dialogues.speaker: MISS FINE
dialogues.text: You know you’re matching, right?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (re: Molly’s scarf) Well we added an embellishment...

dialogues.speaker: MISS FINE
dialogues.text: Lucky for you two I’m a 30-year old single woman. Which means I’ve got a lot of shit in my car. Why don’t you go through some of those bags?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, we can touch your clothes?

dialogues.speaker: MISS FINE
dialogues.text: Please. Please touch my clothes. Please change your clothes. Molly closes her eyes in ecstasy.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: This night...  70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car stops down the street from an obvious PARTY HOUSE Molly and Amy step out of the car in brand new outfits-- cool, stylish, colorful dresses. They fawn over each othe

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY AMY
dialogues.text: Ummmmm...I have no breath? Hmmmmmmm. . . WHAT?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: I have nowhere to go with this. It’s too perfect.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You're literally glowing.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: You've just come out of the water, you're a mermaid...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: How are you so fucking shiny? Miss Fine watches, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Can you fetch me my inhaler? Cause

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: My eyes! My eyes hurt so bad from your beauty!

dialogues.speaker: MISS FINE
dialogues.text: Excuse me, ladies? There’s a party to go to... Molly and Amy laugh, sheepish and delighted.

dialogues.speaker: MISS FINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll see you two inside. Molly and Amy glance at each other-- but then Miss Fine laughs like she’s kidding. They laugh, too.

dialogues.speaker: MISS FINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m kidding. Can you imagine? That'd be weird, right? It’d be weird. Anyway. See y’all later!  71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly and Amy nervously walk up to the party. Music THUMP from inside, getting louder as they get closer. They reac the front door, give each other encouraging smiles, and c hands.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Love you.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Love you. They push the door open... INT. NICK'S AUNT’S HOUSE - NIGHT It’s exactly what you’d hope a high school party would be throbbing with sweaty, horny, giddy TEENAGERS. Everybody' high off of the year ending and emotional about it being over. People play drinking games, laugh and squeal with e other, dance on couches. Molly peers through the crowd and finds Nick across the r He’s having fun with his friends. But then his eyes wander and he locks eyes with...Molly. We PUSH IN on Molly as she feels the spark-- Then we PUSH IN on Nick as he realizes he’s been waiting a girl who challenges him mentally and emotionally-- And when we pull back out, the rest of the party has DISAPPEARED. Nick walks toward Molly and reaches out his hand. She takes it and they burst into AMAZING CHOREOGRAP It’s unbelievably romantic. They can’t take their eyes of each other as they dance like old-school movie stars. Nic dips her and they’re about to kiss and when he grabs a BE CAN and CRUSHES it against his forehead--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly's jolted back to reality as the real Nick crushes a BEER CAN on his forehead across the room. Suddenly a RAND PARTIER walking by spots Molly and Amy and stops--

dialogues.speaker: RANDOM PARTIER
dialogues.text: Whoooa! You two?! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Molly and Amy brace themselves to be made fun of...but th the whole room CHEERS! A few people TOAST their beers. Somebody offers HIGH-FIVES. Tanner walks by--

dialogues.speaker: TANNER
dialogues.text: El Presidente!

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: The protest lady! Everyone's happy to see them. The girls are surprised. Mo peers around Tanner to find Nick, but he’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: TANNER
dialogues.text: Welcome my little turtledoves! I’m so happy you guys are here! You want a drink? Smoke? Drink? You guys want a drink, you come to me, ‘cause you guys are the best, honestly you freaked me out but I’m gonna miss you, cause class of ‘19 for-fucking-ever. Everybody CHEERS again. Molly and Amy share a happy smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly and Amy make their way through the party, dancing a little. They’re having fun. Then Molly’s eyes go wide--

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: She grabs Amy and points to the KITCHEN, where Ryan's laughing with some SKATER FRIENDS. She looks beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Look how nice her skin looks.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Go get her.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: She's busy, she’s with her friends--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Amy! You can do this. Think of those perfect breasts in that bra just waiting to be freed. And her nipples, like two sparkling plastic panda eyes-- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Okay! Okay. (gesturing over at Nick) Good luck. To any woman trying to sexually please Nick after tonight, because you’re about to set the bar WAY too high. They high-five, hug and Amy starts walking toward the kitchen. Molly turns back to the bar and Tanner hands her drink-- just as Gigi rises from below the bar--

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Tanner we're out of sugar cubes.

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: No. Nope. No. Not possible. How?! How are you here?!

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: I missed you. I’m gonna go downstairs. She pretends to take an elevator below the bar. Tanner's delighted. INT. NICK'S AUNT’S HOUSE - NIGHT Over by the door, Miss Fine walks in, dancing, trying to blend in. Theo clocks her from across the room and frantically undoes his PIGTAILS. It’s go time. INT. KITCHEN - NICK’S AUNT’S HOUSE - NIGHT Ryan pours Amy a drink.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Dude! I’m so stoked you’re here. I’ve always wanted you to come out. Amy's stunned. Is this is her moment?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I am out. I came out in 10th grade. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ryan’s confused, then laughs--

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: No, I mean, like, come out on a weekend. Hang out. Amy blushes so deeply she may pass out.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Me too. That’s what I meant, also.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: You gotta have a little fun before you leave for Africa.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (touched) You remembered I’m going to Africa?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Uganda or something, right?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Botswana. They’d kill me in Uganda.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh. Cause that country’s not really a fan of gay people. (awkwardly fishing) So...would you be afraid to go to Uganda too? They're suddenly distracted as Gigi marches by, directing

dialogues.speaker: GIGI
dialogues.text: Karaoke in the guest room! Ryan grabs Amy’s hand and starts pulling her down the hal

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: You wanna do karaoke? Amy glances down at her hand, thrilled. INT. LIVING ROOM - NICK’S AUNT’S HOUSE - NIGHT Molly's still hovering in the corner, watching Nick play PONG. She takes a deep breath and walks over to him. When Nick notices her, he jumps to his feet, amazed-- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Holyyyy SHIT. MOLLY'S HERE?! He’s a little drunk and genuinely delighted to see her.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you really here? Is this a mirage? Did I get President Molly to come out on a weekend?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: (blushing, rolls her eyes) It’s a purely ceremonial visit. Nick laughs, then brings her to the table.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Okay, sit down. Sit right here. Right next to me. Student Council ticket versus those douchebags. I've been waiting for this since like second grade. He starts arranging the beer pong cups. Molly tries to hi her grin as she attempts to help. INT. GUEST ROOM - NICK’S AUNT’S HOUSE - NIGHT George stands dramatically with the karaoke microphone.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: This song goes out to my cast. He starts singing Alanis Morissette’s “YOU OUGHTA KNOW.” They've projected the LYRICS onto the wall with Nick’s Au old projector. George sings VERY emotionally as Gigi watc aroused. Amy and Ryan laugh at George, whispering to each other. At one point Ryan flings her arm across Amy's thig Amy tries to stay calm but she can’t hide a beaming grin.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You-- You-- You OUGHTTA KNOW! ALAN! He collapses as Gigi comforts him. The mic is free, and R grabs Amy, trying to pull her onstage--

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Okay, your turn! You gotta sing! Amy protests, but Ryan forces the mic into her hand-- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s go, Amy! Do it for me! Amy takes the mic, so nervous the sound starts to drop ou But Ryan’s watching her, smiling, and so she takes a deep breath and belts the chorus--

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: And I’m here! To remind you! Of the mess you left when you went away! Amy sings her heart out, hitting every note, and it’s beautiful. The whole room’s astonished, cheering loudly.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: You can tell she’s not supporting, no breath control, but it’s good! It’s on pitch! Amy finishes with a flourish and Ryan grabs her in a hug.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Dude! What the fuck?! How are you so good? (to the room)

dialogues.speaker: I KNOW HER
dialogues.text: Amy blushes, thrilled. This is going better than she hope

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo prepares a drink at the bar, practicing his game.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (to himself) Miss Fine. Miss Foine. Sefiora Fine. (then) You ever made love to a Mexican?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick watches as Molly focuses, then sinks another cup. Sh and Nick CHEER, then do a victory handshake.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Okay, listen. Pong is supposed to be my thing. So if you could tone it down, just for my self-esteem... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: I think you just need to step your game up. You need to rise to my level. Nick laughs.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: It’s crazy that we never hung out outside of school. You seem like you’re all work and no play, but you're pretty fun.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: I am fun.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: You are fun. He grins down at her. Are they flirting?! INT. LIVING ROOM - NICK’S AUNT’S HOUSE - NIGHT Theo approaches Miss Fine by the fireplace.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Hi Miss Fine.

dialogues.speaker: MISS FINE
dialogues.text: Hi, Theo. He hands her a drink.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: For you. I muddled the rosemary myself. Miss Fine takes the drink, skeptical, but her eyes go wid she sips it.

dialogues.speaker: MISS FINE
dialogues.text: This is amazing.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (whispered) You're amazing. She stares at him for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: MISS FINE
dialogues.text: You're 20, right? (CONTINUED )
He nods, mesmerized. Miss Fine downs the rest of her drin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick throws a pong ball and misses.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: You just need more of an arc.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: It’s easy to have an arc when you're like three feet tall. I’m looking straight down.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: How tall are you? Nick stands, grinning down at her.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: How tall do you think I am? This is the sexiest moment of Molly’s life. She stands next to him. A beat.
Nick laughs and groans, pretending he’s been shot.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: My teammates aren’t usually this mean!

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: They're usually blonde and skinny and not into drinking carbs?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: No way. I fuck with Hufflepuffs. Molly's heart skips a beat.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Hufflepuff? Like in Harry Potter?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Yeah. You’re like a half-Ravenclaw, half-Slytherin, right? He might as well have undressed her. right (CONTINUED )

On the other side of the field the car bursts throug gate and drives right onto the field. Everyone turns, startled, as they swerve to drive right up to the stands.

dialogues.speaker: JARED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, my God, my car is fucked up. Amy and Molly stumble out, sprinting to the ceremony--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: (running, out of breath) I’m here! We’re here! The crowd cheers as they run down the aisle. Amy starts t go to her seat but Molly tries to keep her up on stage--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, stay--

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I’ll go to my seat--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: (holding Amy’s arm up)

dialogues.speaker: LOOK WHO MADE IT
dialogues.text: The crowd goes NUTS.

dialogues.speaker: MORE SENIORS
dialogues.text: We want Amy!/AMY!/WE LOVE YOU AMY! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Amy blushes, amazed. Jared hands Molly the speech, eager get off the stage, but Molly stops him, leans in and kiss him! In front of everyone! The crowd LAUGHS and WHISTLES. Jared floats off, dazed. M turns back to the crowd and grips the podium. Despite all her planning, she’s suddenly frozen with nerves.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Okay, uh...it seems like Jared did a pretty good job. She just stands there, taking in her classmates. MOLLY (CONT’D) You know, I was so...scared of you guys, I felt like I had to prove I was better than you. But really, I don’t know any more than you. All I know is that we all have a lot more to learn. Molly locks eyes with Amy. Amy smiles at her, emotional, proud. All of a sudden Molly’s about to cry. MOLLY (CONT’D) Because this part’s over. And that’s so sad. In the audience, Amy nods, tears in her eyes. MOLLY (CONT’D) But it was great, wasn’t it? Things are never going to be the same, but it was perfect. (back to the audience) And I may not have before, but I see you. And you’re great. Don’t let college fuck it up. (then) Congratulations, guys. Amy gives a loud WOOP and the whole crowd CHEERS. Molly t Amy’s hand as George and Alan walk onstage.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Okay! That went over, but I will not be cutting down my allotted time. (calling back) Gigi, hit the track!  100. INT. AMY’S ROOM - LATER THAT DAY Molly and a very emotional Charmaine help Amy pack.

dialogues.speaker: CHARMAINE
dialogues.text: I guess you’ll get an international cellphone when you get there...oh, good! You’re bringing Lingling! Amy's SEX PANDA is poking out of her suitcase. Before Amy stop her, Charmaine pulls out the bear. Amy and Molly wat in horror as she starts SNUGGLING it to her face.

dialogues.speaker: CHARMAINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You give Amy these kisses for me when she gets lonely, okay Lingling? All the way from America! She gives the bear little kisses. The girls recoil--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Make that stop--

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Okay give him back now! I wanna zip up my suitcase! Doug walks in and brightens when he sees--

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Lingling! Lemme get in there--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY AMY
dialogues.text: No! No! Molly slaps Lingling out of Charmaine’s hand before she c hand it to Doug. An awkward beat.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Uh, Amy, there’s someone here to see you. He gestures out through the window -- it’s Hope.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Why is she here? (sees Amy blushing) Amy! Why is she here?  EXT. AMY’S HOUSE - DAY 101. Molly crouches to spy through the window as Amy walks outside, morning-after shy.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: HOPE
dialogues.text: Hey. (then) I just wanted to bring back your clothes. She hands Amy a plastic bag. Behind Hope, Molly freaks ou and starts SIGNING as Amy tries to ignore her.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Thank you. Thank you so much. I don’t usually leave my underwear places that...aren’t my room.

dialogues.speaker: HOPE
dialogues.text: I figured.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: How was-- did you-- are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: HOPE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m fine. Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yeah. You know, prison kinda changes you, but... Hope laughs. Amy grins.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm fine. I’m sorry. I just kinda have no idea what I’m doing with that stuff yet.

dialogues.speaker: HOPE
dialogues.text: Well, for someone who has no idea what they’re doing...you kinda know what you're doing. She raises her eyebrows and gives Amy a little smile. Amy blushes so hard she laughs. She might die.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: That’s-- um-- that’s cool. So what are you, how is your summer going? (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean, what are you doing this summer?

dialogues.speaker: HOPE
dialogues.text: I think I’m gonna backpack around for a bit.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Really? Where?

dialogues.speaker: HOPE
dialogues.text: I don’t really know. Anywhere I can find a couch to crash. I just wanna see some stuff before college.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: That’s-- me too. Same. That’s why I’m doing a gap year. A nice moment. They weren't expecting that.

dialogues.speaker: HOPE
dialogues.text: Well, have fun, nerd. She hands Amy a slip of paper with her information on it. takes it, stunned. Hope starts to walk away, and Amy call after her--

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: If you ever end up in Botswana, you'd have a couch to crash on. (can’t help herself) Technically it won't be my couch because I’m staying with a family but I’m sure they'll be cool with it! Hope smile at her and keeps walking. Amy celebrates, then sprints inside--

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Molly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy's car inches around the bustling, chaotic airport.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Amy, this thing drives like a cruise ship. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Well, she’s yours now. Take care of the old Volvo for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly drives, Amy shotgun, back to riding like buddy cops

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Speaking of vulvas, remember when you missed Hope’s and just went straight for that BUTTHOLE!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Once a day. I said you could bring it up once a day--

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: I’m stocking up for your travel days! They both laugh. Molly pulls over and stops the car. Thei laughs die down. MOLLY (CONT’D) It’s so weird being on the driver's side. Everything feels off.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I can’t believe I’m not gonna see you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Call me from your weird international flip phone, okay?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I will. Okay bye. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Bye. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Bye. Amy gets out and heaves out her bag.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Go make those tampons, girl.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I will! Bye. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Bye. Amy just stands there in the window.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What’s a year, right? They can’t look at each other. Amy closes the door and Mo pulls back into the traffic. She turns back, but Amy’s no looking. Molly tries to get a hold of herself as she inch away, lost in thought. This is the next phase of her-- BAM! Suddenly an out-of-breath Amy slams up against the passenger window. Molly SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Oh my GOD! What the fuck is wrong with you?! I was going through a thing! I was going through a whole emotional goodbye thing! Amy dives back into the passenger seat, out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I can be the last one on the plane. (grins) Wanna get pancakes? Molly beams.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Fuck yeah I do.
